titleInfo.title: Cooperative Store at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 3 x 4 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#453 JCRS Buildings''. On back of print ''#453 JCRS Cooperative Store in Business Office''.

mods.abstract: Interior of the Cooperative Store on the grounds of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The store was located in the Business Office. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
